definition: to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: If you don't pay people, they are more committed to the cause.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不付錢給這些人，他們就對競選更加投入。

sentences.english: He let another customer through while he fumbled in his pocket for money.
sentences.chinese: 於是他讓下一位顧客先付錢，他則在一邊掏兜找錢。

sentences.english: In first - class stateroom cabin , you can get the best services but you must pay more.
sentences.chinese: 在頭等艙可以得到最好的服務，但那是你付錢買來的。

sentences.english: He's quite willing to pay the price I ask.
sentences.chinese: 他很願意照我的要價付錢。

sentences.english: Why pay someone else to do it for you?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼要付錢讓別人爲你虧錢呢？

sentences.english: People pay you to paint their logos onto your cow.
sentences.chinese: 人們付錢給你，可以在牛身上亂畫他們的商標。

sentences.english: "We're paying for both sides in the war on terror," says Woolsey.
sentences.chinese: “我們要爲反恐戰爭的雙方付錢，”吳爾西說。

sentences.english: Who actually pays you to do this?
sentences.chinese: 事實上是誰付錢讓你幹這個的？

sentences.english: I think he may have paid me to mow his lawn or something.
sentences.chinese: 我想他可能曾經付錢讓我給他割草坪或其他什麼的。

sentences.english: Eventually the heirs pay the yard to have it towed off and junked.
sentences.chinese: 最後繼承舊船的人還得付錢給船廠把它們拖走和廢棄。

sentences.english: In effect, Europe could be paying for its own future domination.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，歐洲能做的就是爲其未來的命運付錢。

sentences.english: It forked money over only when faced with the prospect of violence.
sentences.chinese: 它也是在被暴力挾持的情況下才無奈選擇付錢。

sentences.english: He planked down the money and called for drinks for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 他爽快地付錢請大家喝酒。

sentences.english: I am one of the guys who pays tax to support your monthly food stamp.
sentences.chinese: 我就是那個每個月付錢給你買糧票的那個人。

sentences.english: We routinely do not pay for most other forms of water.
sentences.chinese: 我們常常不需要爲了其他形式的水付錢。

definition: to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結賬|结账
to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
